required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Interventions for Postoperative Delirium: Biomarker-2 (IPOD-B2) Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The IPOD-B2 Study aims to understand the pathogenesis of postoperative delirium in patients undergoing major surgery. The investigators will identify then correlate soluble biomarkers in blood and cerebral spinal fluid with changes in High Density-Electroencephalogram.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline and correlation between biomarker levels in CSF and HD-EEG changes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-operative measure: Up to 4 weeks prior to surgery. Post-operative measure: Up to postoperative day (POD) 9

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute changes in biomarkers in CSF and plasma in delirious and non-delirious patients between baseline and post-operative period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-operative measure: Up to 4 weeks prior to surgery. Post-operative measure: Up to postoperative day (POD) 9

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between biomarkers in CSF and plasma in delirious and non-delirious patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-operative measure: Up to postoperative day (POD) 9

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute changes in activity and connectivity in HD-EEG from baseline to postoperative
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-operative measure: Up to 4 weeks prior to surgery. Post-operative measure: Up to postoperative day (POD) 9

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of biomarkers with the incidence of spinal cord ischemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-operative measure: Up to 4 weeks prior to surgery. Post-operative measure: Up to postoperative day (POD) 9

biospec_descr.textblock: Participant blood and cerebral spinal fluid samples will be collected and stored for future analysis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing elective open thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm or thoracic endovascular aortic/aneurysm repair surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult (>21 years old)
2. Patients scheduled for an elective open thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm or TEVAR (thoracic endovascular aortic/aneurysm repair)
3. Requiring spinal drain for surgery that is predicted to stay in two or more days
4. Willing and able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Contraindication for spinal drain
2. Documented history of dementia
3. Unable to communicate with the research staff due to language barriers
4. Individuals who the PI determines are not appropriate for the study such as a history of appointment cancellations.
5. Pregnant or Nursing
6. Prisoners

overall_official.affiliation: University of Wisconsin-Madison, School of Medicine and Public Health
